settings.blog-title: DRESS LIKE A LOCAL: HOW TO BLEND IN ON YOUR NEXT VACATION

settings.text:
When it comes to jetsetting around the world, the best way to truly experience it is by immersing yourself in the culture, whether it’s tasting national dishes or dressing like a local.

Nobody wants to stick out as a tourist, not least because it makes you a prime target for pickpockets, but more so you’ll want to fit in. After all, who wouldn’t want to feel like a Parisian in Paris or a New Yorker in the Big Apple?

Fashion trends vary around the world, based on which fashion houses call it home, the climate, and the energy of the city. So, if you have any upcoming travel plans and want to fit in, Chinti & Parker is here to help with some flawless seasonal looks for the world’s most fashionable cities.

settings.grid-content:
The French capital is consistently hailed as the fashion capital of the world, giving birth to the likes of Saint Laurent, Christian Dior and Louis Vuitton, as well as many others.

Come fall and winter, the city is bustling, with strolls along the Seine in the crisp, autumnal air being picture perfect. Autumn opens with the build up to September’s highly anticipated Fashion Week - when chic descends on the city - but no matter the time of the year, Parisians know how to dress.

Spring/Summer
Spend an evening enjoying the eateries of Canal Saint Martin or afternoon along the Promenade Plantee and you’ll spot Parisians looking just as splendid as the surroundings. Neutral colours provide the base for much of the city’s style, with button down shirts and tailored blazers, coats, and designer jeans staple items.

The knee-length skirt is a must-have for Parisians, and this season we predict flower power to be in full flow, with colder days accompanied by classic layering and sweaters.

settings.text:
Autumn/Winter
As the nights draw in and the temperatures start to drop, you’ll start to see thicker knits and wool-blend blazers take to the streets of Pigalle. When it comes to winter rotations, French women look for timeless pieces, with burgundy, navy and other neutral colours propping up a Parisian’s wardrobe.

It’s trouser season in the city, and cardigans and turtleneck sweaters provide the perfect accompaniment. When the rain comes down, the trench coat and umbrella take over the nooks and crannies around Montmartre, trickling down the cobblestone streets, completing a truly Parisian look.

settings.grid-content:
From one city of style to another, Milan is a sanctuary of glamour with many world famous designers housing their flagship stores in the iconic Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II. Think Milan and you’ll think statement sunglasses, deepest blacks, and a style that oozes effortless sophistication.

A year round destination, taking in the Lakes across the spring and summer months, and the Fashion Weeks of September and early spring, you really do have to look the part in the majestic North Italian city.

Spring/Summer
There are two sides to Milan in the spring and summer, but locals typically enjoy floral and clashing patterns, complemented with bold accessories including sunglasses, silk scarves and shoulder bags.

Wide brim sun hats are popular on the shores of Como and Garda, with capri sandals and shorts completing a casual, yet classic, look.

To help alter your mindset when it comes to consumption, here’s 10 things everyone should know about sustainable fashion, from Chinti & Parker.

settings.text:
Autumn/Winter
A stone’s throw from the Alps, come winter it’s time to wrap up and out comes the cashmere once again. Sweaters are paired with flowing trench coats, with snug scarves and hats being two must-have accessories. The Milanese don’t drop the sunglasses though, with a chic pair being a year-round staple.

Heeled leather boots are a popular choice for strolling around the city, with neutral blends keeping everything classic in Milan.

settings.grid-content:
When it comes to LA fashion, it’s all about simplicity. There’s nothing complicated about the Californian lifestyle and it’s the same with your wardrobe. From beach days in Malibu to hikes in Griffith Park, the LA look keeps it laid back, with plenty of washed denim, slouchy tees and vintage sunglasses.

You’ll find temperatures in the 20s all year round, but that doesn’t mean you shouldn’t be prepared for a cold snap, with fleeces and oversized blazers a popular choice for locals.

Spring/Summer
The people of LA love to, quite literally, get their skates on in the summer, and the city is bustling with trails to enjoy as the sun beams down. Sun hats and sunglasses are essential year round accessories, whilst short and shirt sets are all the rage, with people around the world inspired by the style.

In the city, long summer dresses are popular, with LA women radiating sophistication as they wander through Beverly Hills and Bel Air.

settings.text:
Autumn/Winter
With temperatures still mild in the winter, you can leave your woollen coats at home and opt for turtlenecks and cardigans to keep you warm as the evenings draw in. Style and sophistication still comes with the simple LA style and you’ll find day-to-day a lot of roomy cashmere jumpers and cardigans, alongside wide-legged jeans and trousers.

settings.title: SEOUL
settings.text:
Seoul is the heart and soul of South Korea, with the capital home to almost 10 million locals. Practicality is at the heart of the city’s look; as the bright lights and skyscrapers loom over locals, it’s the bold colours and patterns that take centre stage on the streets, with a unique look that is unlike anywhere else on earth.

Spring/Summer
The summer months in South Korea can reach highs of 30°, so it’s no surprise that wardrobe practicality is key. The loose look is part and parcel of the city vibe in Seoul, with wide-leg jeans and chunky, clean sneakers exactly what you need to get from A to B.

The top half is there to make a statement, with crochet tops and boxy T-shirts for the warmest of days, complemented by short sleeve jackets and quirky jumpers and sweaters when the sun isn’t as bright.

Autumn/Winter
Visit Seoul in the winter and you’ll be faced with a sea of puffer jackets. It’s believed around 80% of the population own one, so if you’re looking for the true South Korean look, you know where to start.

Whilst a padded jacket will complete the look, long patterned dresses and biker boots adorn the most stylish of Seoul, as they enjoy evenings out in Gangnam and the Brooklyn-like Seongsu-dong.

MAKE SMALL, GRADUAL CHANGES

Small, gradual changes can make working towards a more sustainable lifestyle appear less overwhelming, particularly for those at the beginning of their journey. Start out small, do your research, and forgive yourself for occasional and minor setbacks - nobody becomes the perfect ethical fashion consumer overnight.

settings.grid-content:
The Big Apple is a dream destination for many, and when it comes to shopping, there are few places on the planet that compare. Style varies across the city, with each borough having its own unique look and culture, whether you’re in downtown Manhattan or the East Village.

New Yorkers love to embrace trends and they certainly don’t hold back. The urban style is popular right now, with hoodies and jogging bottoms providing the relaxed look needed for the subway and being comfortable amidst the
hectic NYC lifestyle.

Spring/Summer
New York women don’t hold back, and you’ll find a plethora of styles walking down the street. Trainer culture is a big part of life in NYC life, and has been for generations. A pristine white pair is a staple, although vibrant colours regularly turn heads on the sidewalk.

Combine sneakers with casual wear during the day, whilst those working in the city may find themselves donning statement pieces and embracing the LBD.

settings.text:
Autumn/Winter
Winter in New York is cold. Very cold. Like Seoul, the puffer jacket is a staple, whilst heavy boots, scarves and multiple layers are a must as you drop in and out of the many museums, galleries and department stores.

Chunky knitwear is a necessity, with darker colours the predominant feature. Long skirts are popular among the braver women who are really looking to make a statement.
